:
-------:
Product ID26203
Account emailmia.weierst@regiondo.com
Supplier ID9999
Order #2081752868, 2081752754
Novomind Ticket ID80137
EnvironmentWindows 10, Chrome Version 79.0.3945.130 (Offizieller Build) (64-Bit)

issue appear global and also on staging.
See screencast (Aufnahme #23) attached.

#### Steps to reproduce:
1. Place several bookings for Product ID 26203 for the same appointment (in my case #2081752868 #2081752754 for appointment Wednesday, February 26th 2020 8am)
2. Go to calendar and search for the appointment Wednesday, February 26th 2020 8am



3. Click on appointment and choose alter appointment



4. Add another day (in my case I choose 27th 2020 8am)



5. Click on alter booking


#### Actual result:
The system says Appointments reschedule to 02/27/2020, 08:00 is in progress, but no alteration of appointment from 26th to 27th february is happening.





#### Expected result:
The appointment should be altered to the new appointment, in this case 02/27/2020, 08:00

#### Steps to reproduce:
1- Book 2 tickets for product 128647 (Booking number 2081689708 )
Ticket SE133139PX1W7
Ticket SE133IQ2D7U8A

2- Cancel only one ticket SE133139PX1W7


3- Alter ticket SE133IQ2D7U8A to 31-03-2020 12:00 and confirm the change ()



#### Actual result:
1- After altering the booking, No new Ticket is generated

2- Customer receive email Confirmation of change But when he click on see Change, he is redirected to new page which remain Loading


3- This email is not listed in Magento > Message queue


#### Expected result:

1- After altering ticket SE133IQ2D7U8A , Ticket code SE133IQ2D7U8A should be updated (Both ticket should be displayed : the cancelled one + the updated one )


2- Customer should receive the new ticket by email
Example :

URLhttps://themorningstarcompany.regiondo.com/xxx
Product ID85986
Account emailaline.morgenstern@regiondo.com
Supplier ID21511
novomind ticket62445
EnvironmentWindows 10, Chrome Version 75.0.3770.142

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Login to dashboard with aline.morgenstern@regiondo.com

  2. Go to Manage offers > My offer bundles and click on "Bundle offer" (product ID 85986).

  3. Go to step 3 tickets and set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to e.g. 14 days.

  4. Save and publish offer and open it in ticketshop: https://themorningstarcompany.regiondo.com/xxx

  5. Choose a day and time for the first offer where less than 14 days are left until the end of the month, e.g. 26th August, 8 a.m.

Actual result:

For the second offer, only the days 26th to 31st of August are shown for selection, which is within 6 days of the date that has been selected for the first offer. The remaining 8 days that were set up as availability in the offer creation, do not show up --> The period of 14 days that was set in the offer creation is not fully shown due to switch of calendar months.

The same thing happens when minutes or hours is used in the offer creation process.

Offer Sternenregen in Sternstadt Availability

Offer STADIUM TOUR

Expected result:

Even when there is a change of months, the availability should be completely displayed as was set in offer creation.

Checked on testing with demoaccount@regiondo.de

  1. Edited the bundle id 112465 (Book it and bond) and went to step 3 tickets, set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days and selected option stating that the 'Customer selects start time for each activity (customer only selects first activity start time per default)':

    Chose the first activity to be on the 26th of December 2019. For the 2nd product we have the availability set up for the 14 days even if it's prolonged for the next month too â

  2. Edited the same bundle and went to step 3 tickets, set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days and selected option stating that the 'Customer is free to choose the sequence of activities'

    I'm able to select which one will start first and the 14 days are added accordingly to the selection, regardless of which activity I select to start first, even if it's prolonged for the next month too â

  3. Edited the same bundle and only went to step 3 tickets to set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days

    The first added product in the bundle is displayed first and after selecting the date of participation for this one, for the 2nd one the date is the same as for the 1st one, or it's the closest in the future. Correct behavior â

Checked on staging with demoaccount@regiondo.de
Edited the bundle id 24303 (Same product - Friends pack) that has 3 products and went to 'step 3 tickets', set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days and selected option stating that the 'Customer selects start time for each activity (customer only selects first activity start time per default)':

Chose the first activity to be on the 26th of December 2019. For the 2nd product we have the availability set up for the 14 days even if it's prolonged for the next month too â

Issues

  1. Wording - the phrase 'Activities should start taking place within BUNDLE_PARAM_WITHIN_DAYS_START' should be 'Activities should start taking place within'
  2. Availability shown for the 3rd product isn't fully shown (it misses the part from the next month where we should have availability until the 8th of January 2020):
  • this is the availability for the 3rd product present in the bundle (id 23939 - 'English Offer')
  • this is the availability shown when selecting the 3rd product from the bundle where the availability is missing for the 3rd product, in January (for the 2nd one we have the right availability)

Bug happens in this condition app/code/local/Regiondo/Product/Model/Bundle/Pricelist.php:238
steps to reproduce

  1. Open product view page with three components bundle
  2. Choose for first and second components dates and times
  3. Switch to next month third component
    If choose for second component same month as for third component then exception not throws.
    So I think need to improove condition app/code/local/Regiondo/Product/Model/Bundle/Pricelist.php:238

@Bogdan Cumpanasu, @Aline Morgenstern,
1. Regarding the error message in dashboard: 'Some bundle components are not available anymore and were disconnected from the bundle. Probably their sale period ended or they have manual confirmation or were removed':

The bundle components are not available anymore in English store, for which you are trying to edit the Bundle component. That's why we show this message. If you try to edit the same bundle in German store it works fine.

2. Regarding the missing last date of the month in the calendar: fixed, please verify on testing.

The issue can be reproduced with the following bundle configuration:
First product:

  • available each day of the month at 15:00.
  • duration of the event: 1 hour (not sure if this is necessary though)

Second product:

  • available each day of the month at 8:00

Bundle:

  • consists of these two products in this exact order
  • Customer selects start time for each activity: YES
  • Activities should start taking place within: 18 HOURS

Please first create this setup on staging to ensure that it is reproduced. And then test the same setup on testing to verify that it is fixed.

Legal comment:

Betreiber der BuchungslÃ¶sung ist der jeweilige Partner. Er verpflichtet sich auch nach den neuen SaaS-AGB dazu, die BuchungslÃ¶sung gesetzeskonform zu betreiben. GrundsÃ¤tzlich ist es damit seine Sache, wie er die Einbeziehung der AGB, etc., gestaltet. Ich wÃ¼rde den Partner dafÃ¼r die MÃ¶glichkeit bieten, diesen Text selbst zu formulieren. Gern kÃ¶nnt Ihr natÃ¼rlich das Formulierungsbeispiel zur VerfÃ¼gung stellen.
Checkbox-LÃ¶sung fÃ¼r AGB, Widerrufsbelehrung und Datenschutzhinweise mÃ¶glich, aber nicht zwingend, wenn das von mir geschilderte Procedere/die geschilderte Platzierung und Verlinkung eingehalten werden. Dazu ein Kommentarauszug wie folgt, der vielleicht etwas Aufschluss Ã¼ber die Anforderungen im e-commerce gibt:
â2. Die LÃ¶sung mit Haken fÃ¼r AGB, DatenschutzerklÃ¤rung, Widerrufsbelehrung & Co â ein Muss?

Recht verbreitet ist bei Webshops, dass die Kunden im Rahmen des Bestellvorgangs (entweder unmittelbar beim Bestellen oder zumindest bei der vorgeschalteten Erstellung eines Kundenkontos) mit dem Setzen eines HÃ¤kchens bestÃ¤tigen mÃ¼ssen, dass sie die AGB, die DatenschutzerklÃ¤rung und/oder die Widerrufsbelehrung gelesen und zur Kenntnis genommen haben. Es stellt sich die Frage, ob diese Art der Einbindung von AGB & Co fÃ¼r Webshop-Betreiber zwingend ist oder ob es beispielsweise ausreichen wÃ¼rde, wenn Online-HÃ¤ndler lediglich auf ihre AGB hinweisen wÃ¼rden.

a.) Die HÃ¤kchen-LÃ¶sung ist nicht zwingend

Um die Antwort vorwegzunehmen: die HÃ¤kchen-LÃ¶sung ist rechtlich nicht notwendig. FÃ¼r AGB gilt Â§ 305 Absatz 2 BGB, wonach die AGB des Online-HÃ¤ndlers dann Vertragsbestandteil des Kaufvertrags mit dem Kunden werden, wenn der Kunde bei Vertragsschluss durch einen ausdrÃ¼cklichen und deutlichen Hinweis auf sie aufmerksam gemacht worden ist und er die AGB unter zumutbaren UmstÃ¤nden zur Kenntnis nehmen konnte. Es ist nicht erforderlich, dass der Kunde sich ausdrÃ¼cklich mit den AGB einverstanden erklÃ¤rt.

Teilweise wird jedoch diskutiert, ob die HÃ¤kchen-LÃ¶sung wegen der spÃ¤teren leichteren Beweisbarkeit der Einbindung der AGB sinnvoll sei. Wenn Webshop-Betreiber im Streitfall, etwa vor Gericht, nicht beweisen kÃ¶nnten, dass die angesprochenen Voraussetzungen vorgelegen haben und die AGB somit Vertragsbestandteil geworden sind, dann kÃ¶nnten sie womÃ¶glich einen Rechtsstreit verlieren. Um dies zu verhindern, wÃ¼rde es sich nach Ansicht mancher anbieten, die Kunden das berÃ¼hmte HÃ¤kchen setzen zu lassen. Denn aufgrund des Protokollierens des Bestellvorgangs inklusive des HÃ¤kchen-Setzens auf dem Server des Webshop-Betreibers habe dieser spÃ¤ter sichere Beweise in der Hand.

Aufgrund unserer Erfahrungen aus der Praxis kÃ¶nnen wir diese Sorge jedoch nicht teilen. Bislang war die Beweisbarkeit der Einbindung der AGB in unserer Praxis nie ein Problem. Daher genÃ¼gt es regelmÃ¤Ãig, wenn Online-HÃ¤ndler in deutlicher Weise auf ihre AGB hinweisen und im Rahmen dieses Hinweises ihren Kunden den Textinhalt der AGB, etwa durch Verlinkung des Begriffs âAGBâ, zur VerfÃ¼gung stellen. Diese LÃ¶sung hat fÃ¼r die Online-HÃ¤ndler zudem den Vorteil, dass die Kunden nicht allein deswegen von einer Bestellung Abstand nehmen, weil ihnen das Setzen des HÃ¤kchens suspekt ist. Denn erfahrungsgemÃ¤Ã schrecken einige Kunden davor zurÃ¼ck, das HÃ¤kchen zu setzen, weil sie Angst davor haben, dadurch einen Nachteil zu erlangen, etwa weil sie in etwas einwilligen kÃ¶nnten, was sie gar nicht wollen.

b.) Andere ErklÃ¤rungen brauchen ebenso kein HÃ¤kchen

Im Ergebnis gilt dasselbe auch fÃ¼r die DatenschutzerklÃ¤rung und die Widerrufsbelehrung sowie fÃ¼r weitere, Ã¤hnliche Informationen. Gesetzlich vorgeschrieben ist es jeweils nicht, dass der Kunde die Kenntnisnahme dieser Informationen ausdrÃ¼cklich bestÃ¤tigt.

Daher genÃ¼gt es auch hier, wenn die Online-HÃ¤ndler ihre Kunden auf diese ErklÃ¤rungen deutlich hinweisen und ihnen durch Verlinkung der jeweiligen Begriffe die MÃ¶glichkeit verschaffen, von den Inhalten der ErklÃ¤rungen Kenntnis zu erlangen.â

Der zitierte ErwÃ¤gungsgrund bezieht sich auf FÃ¤lle, in denen die Einwilligung nach DSGVO erforderlich ist, was hier aber nicht der Fall ist. Eine solche Einwilligung ist beispielsweise nÃ¶tig, wenn ein Newsletter-Abo abgeschlossen werden soll. [{"id":"dev-17227","entityId":"86-22737","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[gift voucher redemption] decline of booking request for invisible price lists not possible"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Stefan Seitz"},{"name":"created","value":"1580740777805"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"17227"},{"name":"description","value":"
URLhttps://www.regiondo.com/resellers/account/bookingsview/key/
Product ID106594
Account emailiris.gligorea@regiondo.com
Supplier ID23776
Order #1980837026
Novomind Ticket ID79604



#### Steps to reproduce:
1. https://itsoftwaresibiu.regiondo.com/categories > Offer "Optional: Ticketshop title" > buy 1 ticket as gift for variation "2nd price list", option "asdadfafa" > complete purchase
2. Login > manage offers > my offers > product 106594 > Step 3 > set option "asdadfafa" to invisible > save and publish
3. https://itsoftwaresibiu.regiondo.com/voucher > redeem voucher for any date > request date
4. bookings > bookings > check booking for redeemed gift voucher


#### Actual result:

only "apply changes" button appears, clickng this button is followed by no action
no possibility to decline booking




#### Expected result:

Same as in https://track.regiondo.com/issue/dev-16595

When customer redeems gift certificate for an offer with invisible price list, supplier should have the same booking details template like offer with manual confirmation in order to let supplier decide if he accepts or declines the request.

When supplier declines the request, only value voucher should be proposed as refund method.

Refund should be done to the attendee not to the buyer
